title: Pad Thai Chicken
description: Stir-fried rice noodles tossed with tender marinated chicken, eggs, crunchy peanuts, and bright tamarind-sweet-salty sauce. Quick high-heat wok cooking delivers chewy noodles, toasted aromatics, and a balance of umami, sour, and sweetness.

ingredients.display_name: dried flat rice noodles (about 1/4 inch wide)
ingredients.notes: soak in warm water until pliable (per package), drain before stir-frying

ingredients.display_name: boneless skinless chicken thighs, thinly sliced
ingredients.notes: slice against the grain into thin strips
reserve a small handful for garnish

ingredients.display_name: green onions, sliced (white and green parts separated)
ingredients.notes: slice white parts for cooking, greens for garnish
or tamarind paste diluted per package instructions

ingredients.display_name: dried red chili flakes or sliced fresh red chili

steps.text: Prepare noodles by soaking dried rice noodles in warm water until pliable but not fully soft; drain and set aside. If using fresh rice noodles, separate gently and keep at room temperature.
Mix the sauce: combine tamarind concentrate, fish sauce, soy sauce, and palm sugar in a bowl; stir until sugar is dissolved and adjust balance of sour/salty/sweet to taste.

Heat a wok or large heavy skillet over high heat until very hot, add half the oil and swirl to coat. Add sliced chicken in a single layer and stir-fry until just cooked through and lightly browned; remove chicken to a plate.
Add remaining oil to the hot wok, then add minced garlic and sliced shallot; stir-fry briefly until fragrant and beginning to soften but not burned.
Push aromatics to the side of the wok, pour in beaten eggs into the cleared area, scramble gently until just set, then toss with aromatics.

Return cooked chicken to the wok and add drained noodles; pour the prepared sauce over the noodles and toss vigorously, using tongs or two spatulas, to coat and heat through — let noodles sit briefly to absorb sauce if needed.
Add bean sprouts and the white parts of green onions; toss quickly for 30–60 seconds to wilt slightly but keep crunch.
Taste and adjust seasoning with additional fish sauce, sugar, or lime as desired. Remove from heat and transfer to serving plates.
Garnish with chopped roasted peanuts, green onion greens, reserved bean sprouts, chili flakes if using, and lime wedges. Serve immediately.
